label: Description
value: John Paul Jones (1747-1792) is shown on the "Bon home Richard" during his battle with the English frigate, "Serapio." He is about to draw a pistol from his belt. Set in a frame. Inscribed below in French, description of the battle of July 22, 1779 and artists' and publishers' names.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of the painter, William Hogarth, turned to the right, his gaze directed toward the observer. He holds palette in his hand. Inscription, artists' names and publisher's below.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Within an unadorned oval frame is a bust length portrait of the painter, James Gillray, facing left, his gaze directed toward the observer. He wears a striped stock. Inscription below, and engraver's and publisher's names.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Mathias Hovius, Archbishop of Mechlin

label: Description
value: Within an oval frame is the bust portrait of a cleric, wearing a silk robe and white collar. Below, his escutcheon and motto, and inscription.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Robert Kerr, First Earl of Ancram

label: Description
value: Bust length portrait of Robert Kerr, First Earl of Ancram (1755-1813), turned slightly to the left. He has long hair, which protrudes from under a black skull-cap. Below, an escutcheon, dedicatory lines, and names of engraver and publisher.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Claude Hamilton, Earl of Paisley

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of Claude Hamilton, Earl of Paisley (ca. 1543-1622), dressed in half armor, doublet and cape, a feather trimmed velvet beret on his head. He faces frontally, turned slightly to the right. Below, inscription, engraver's and publisher's names.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of a man wearing a van dyck beard and lace collar over a figured doublet. He faces one quarter right. Below, engraver's and artist's names.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Isabel Erskine, Countess of Mar

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the half length portrait of Isabel Erskine, Countess of Mar (late 16th century to early 17th century), facing frontally and wearing a large lace ruff and ribbons in her hair. Inscription below, and publisher's name.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of John Hamilton, Second Early of Belhaven

label: Description
value: Bust length portrait of John Hamilton, Second Early of Belhaven (1656-1708), facing one quarter left, his gaze directed frontally. He wears a large ermine-trimmed cape. Below, inscription and artist's and publisher's names.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of the Scottish poet, James Hogg (1770-1835), known as "The Ettrick Shepherd," shown seated facing frontally, his gaze directed to the right. His left elbow rests on the back of the chair.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of the Scottish poet, Robert Burns (1759-1796), shown facing frontally, his gaze directed slightly to the left. His waistcoat is half unbuttoned, revealing a white linen stock.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of the Scottish inventor James Watt (1736-1819), shown seated at his desk, facing one quarter to the left, his gaze directed frontally. His left forearm rests on the arm of the chair. Books, pen, and drawings shown behind him.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of Alexandre Cabanel (1824-1889), French painter, shown facing on quarter left, his head turned frontally. He wears a full white beard and mustachios. With his left hand he holds his glasses, on a chair. Sitter's name below, and at top, publisher's name.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Shoulder length portrait of the English painter, Sir Laurence Alma-Tadema (1836-1912), his gaze directed to the right. His hair is dishevelled, and he wears a full beard.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Josephus Franken-Sierstorpff, Bishop of Antwerp

label: Description
value: Within an oval frame is the bust portrait of a cleric, wearing a silk robe with a jewelled cross on a chain protruding from the garment's fold. Below, his escutcheon and motto, and inscription.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Sir Herbert von Herkomer

label: Description
value: Head portrait of the artist, his gaze directed forward, head tilted slightly to the left. Lower left, a remarque of two children, one embracing the other. Sitter's name below and at top, publisher's name.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Jean Louis Ernest Meissonier

label: Description
value: Bust length portrait of the French painter, Jean Louis Ernest Meissonier (1815-1891), wearing a beard which flows in two long streamers, his gaze directed to the left. He is shown facing frontally. Sitter's name below, and at top, publisher's name.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of the Austrian painter, Hans Makart (1840-1884), seen turned to the left, his gaze directed frontally. His arms are folded across his chest, and he wears a full beard. Sitter's name below, and at top, publisher's name.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Paul Jacques Aimé Baudry

label: Description
value: Bust length portrait of the French painter, Paul Jacques Aimé Baudry (1828-1886), facing frontally, his head turned slightly to the right. He wears a mustache and rosette of the Légion d'Honneir in his lapel.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of the French revolutionary leader, Jean Paul Marat (1743-1793), shown facing slightly to the right, his gaze directed over his right shoulder. He wears a flowing stock and fur-trimmed coat.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Full length portrait of the French revolutionary leader, Jean Paul Marat (1743-1793), shown standing at a lectern on a platform, pointing down with his right hand and looking over his left shoulder. He wears a flowing stock and fur-trimmed coat.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of George Gordon Lord Byron

label: Description
value: Half length portrait of the English poet, George Gordon Lord Byron (1788-1824), facing one quarter to the right, his gaze directed over his right shoulder. He wears a large cloak thrown loosely over his right shoulder.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Within an oval is a half-length portrait of the French historian, Henri Martin (1810-1883), shown facing frontally, his gaze directed toward the right. He wears a short beard and black bow tie. Illustration for Martin's "Popular History of France."

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Bust length portrait of the American historian and statesman, George Bancroft (1800-1891), shown facing one quarter to the left, his gaze directed before him. He wears a mutton-chop beard and a black bow tie.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Full length portrait of the American Revolutionary general, Nathanial Greene (1742-1786), shown standing before his horse in an open mountainous landscape. He wears a long cape.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Aubertus van den Eede, Bishop of Antwerp

label: Description
value: Within an oval frame is the bust portrait of a cleric, with lip whiskers and dishevelled hair. Below, his escutcheon and motto, and inscription.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

value: Gift of Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Washington on the Bridge at Trenton on His Way To Be Inagurated, 1789

label: Description
value: Women and children strew flowers before Washington and his escort, mounted on horseback crossing the Delaware river at Trenton, the bridge being decked as a bower.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
George Washington and Martha Dandridge Custis Washington

label: Description
value: Shown seated at a table on which is spread an open book and a map are George Washington (1732-1799) and his wife, Martha Dandridge Custis Washington (1732-1802). A drapery is drawn back to the rear revealing a military encampment and a town.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Within an uneven oval is a bust length portrait of Zachary Taylor (1784-1850), twelfth President of the United States (1849-1850), shown in military uniform and facing frontally.

label: Creator name
value: Bureau of Engraving and Printing, U.S. Department of the Treasury, Washington, D.C.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Full length portrait of the American painter, Washington Allston (1779-1843), shown seated, his back to his easel, and beside a table on which is a marble bust. His left foot rests on the rung of a stool beside him on which are palette and brushes. Descriptive lines below, with publisher's name.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Within an arched top frame is the half length portrait of the Scottish poet, Thomas Campbell (1777-1844), shown seated at his desk. His left hand rests on a pile of papers.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Robert Grosvenor, Baron of Ebury

label: Description
value: Three quarter length portrait of Robert Grosvenor, Baron Ebury (1801-1893), shown seated, facing half to the right, his hands folded in his lap.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library

label: Description
value: Half length portrait of James Thomas Brudenell, Seventh Earl of Cardigan (1797-1868), shown facing slightly to the left. He wears full military uniform, his gloves in his left hand and hat in his right. He wears mutton-chop whiskers and mustache.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Frederick Adolphus, Duke of Cambridge

label: Description
value: Three quarter length portrait of Frederick Adolphus, Duke of Cambridge (1774-1850), shown frontally in military uniform, his left hand resting on the hilt of his sword, and his right on his hip. Beyond a balustrade behind him can be seen an army encampment.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Nicholas Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia

label: Description
value: Bust length portrait of Nicholas Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia (1856-1929), shown in naval uniform, facing frontally, his gaze directed slightly to the right.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
Portrait of Clemens Crabbeels, Bishop of Sylva

label: Description
value: Within an oval frame is the bust portrait of a cleric, wearing a beretta and heavy cape. Below, his escutcheon and motto, and inscription.

label: Provenance
value: Given by Cooper Union Museum Picture Library
